SENT.plain: A 12-year-old boy presented with a limp and findings suggesting localised myositis of his right calf and a working diagnosis of Behçet disease was made
During 3 years of follow-up, he had another three episodes of calf myositis, all responsive to corticosteroids within days
CONCLUSION: A case of recurrent localised myositis as a main manifestation of Behçet disease is reported

The evolution of incomplete Behçet disease, which is common in children, to the full blown form, with the emphasis on muscle involvement and the importance of early diagnosis of Behçet disease, is discussed
